description: From French aliquote, from Latin aliquot.

entries.meaning: Contained in the whole an integral number of times, a factor or divisor.
examples: If, therefore, every aliquot diviſion produced a ſenſible effect by it's[sic] vibration, we ſhould hear in every muſical ſtring an infinite variety of chords, diſſonant and conſonant, in ſharp and flat keys at the ſame time.

entries.meaning: (chemistry, biotechnology) A portion of a total amount of a solution or suspension.
examples: Two aliquots each of 57 sample solutions and 15 solutions of NBS Standard No. 950a were assayed.

verbs.description: aliquot (third-person singular simple present aliquots, present participle aliquoting or aliquotting, simple past and past participle aliquoted or aliquotted)

entries.meaning: (chemistry, biotechnology, transitive, informal) To separate a volume of solution or suspension into aliquots.
examples: The nuclear pellet was resuspended in homogenizing buffer (about 25 ml), aliquoted into Eppendorf tubes and stored at -80°C.
